name: sfchronicle
text: A San Francisco Muni bus driver was beaten with a bat Wednesday by passengers who refused to wear face masks at the driver’s instruction, officials said. https://t.co/Pi7kthMzKP

name: sfchronicle
text: Supporters of Shahid Buttar, the November election opponent of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, are rallying around him after an East Coast comedian accused him of sexually harassing her on and off for years starting nearly two decades ago. https://t.co/TUqBUOy2zR

name: sfchronicle
text: Former 49ers defensive lineman Stan Hindman, who spent his entire career with the team before becoming a successful Bay Area architect, died July 15 at age 76. https://t.co/Z9zvi5wfG6

name: sfchronicle
text: Buttery grilled oysters, a nostalgic falafel salad, fancy fungus ravioli and more: https://t.co/QO2QlgvwHd

name: sfchronicle
text: An employee at the Trader Joe’s store located at Stonestown Galleria in San Francisco tested positive for the coronavirus, marking that store’s first and only case, a company spokesperson said. https://t.co/MA1xwemJYK

name: sfchronicle
text:
Floyd, the oldest and tallest giraffe at the San Francisco Zoo, died today after a significant decline in health. The 18-year-old patriarchal giraffe was adored for his serene demeanor, independent spirit and regal stature, zoo staff said.

https://t.co/Cfy8QybP0q

name: sfchronicle
text: “Change can come, but we have to push forward full force." As part of our new series, the Throughline, we spoke to local youth protesters about the changes they want to see in education, policing and racial justice: https://t.co/yPF8gwBpNq

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Trump administration’s proposed restrictions on transgender people in homeless shelters, a population already struggling with homelessness, will probably never be implemented in California because of state law.

https://t.co/bmPJPLzkXy

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Trump administration’s proposed restrictions on transgender people in homeless shelters, aimed at a population already struggling with homelessness, appears to violate California laws on housing discrimination.

https://t.co/5SfLJjegib

name: sfchronicle
text:
Giants manager Gabe Kapler supports pitcher Sam Coonrod's rights to express his beliefs after he decided to not kneel during a pregame ceremony related to BLM.

But Kapler said he will strive to share his feelings on the movement with his pitcher. https://t.co/RkQULWspHj

name: sfchronicle
text:
A’s left-hander A.J. Puk was set to resume throwing Friday, but is likely still weeks away from a possible return due to shoulder inflammation. 
https://t.co/11CmgnvcZ7
